comments.author: dean_tessman@hotmail.com
comments.text:
The fix for bug 588292 introduced new text for the onbeforeunload prompt.

OnBeforeUnloadTitle=Are you sure?
OnBeforeUnloadMessage=This page is asking you to confirm that you want to leave - data you have entered may not be saved.

Two points:
1. The title should not ask a question.
    Suggestion: Confirm Navigation
    Suggestion: Confirm Leaving Page

2. The actual message is awkward.  There's no need for a hyphen.  It should at least be two separate sentences.
    Suggestion: This page is asking you to confirm that you want to leave.  Data that you have entered may not be saved.

(I thought I had already filed this, but I can't find it nor a duplicate.)
